snippet: A black candidate invented by advertisers to satirize Sunday’s general election has become an online sensation but also been accused of reviving offensive stereotypes.

byline.original: By FREDERICK BERNAS and DIANE GHOGOMU

abstract: Argentine advertising firm fields fictional candidate for presidency in comedy campaign aimed at highlighting status quo and racial prejudice in country's political process; effort, which includes wildly popular online video series, features African-Argentine actor ironically mimicking campaign style of Barack Obama; some activists accuse campaign of perpetuating racial stereotypes.
lead_paragraph: A black candidate invented by advertisers to satirize Sunday’s general election has become an online sensation but also been accused of reviving offensive stereotypes.

headline.print_headline: A Candidate Too Good to Be True Draws Attention, and Criticism, in Argentina
headline.main: A Fictional Candidate Draws Attention, and Criticism, in Argentina
